comment.author: 62508825@N00
comment._content:
One possibility:
Henry Marshall Scott married  Alice Kate Hurren in Hoxne, 2nd qr 1901.  Hoxne spans the boundaries of the counties of Norfolk and Suffolk (Source: FreeBMD Hoxne 4a 1601).

Alice Kate Hurren was born in Hoxne 1st qr 1882 (Source: FreeBMD Hoxne 4a703).
 
A Henry M Scott died age 67 1st qr 1939 in Surrey (Source: FreeBMD Surrey N.E. 2a56).

No death date found for Alice K Scott.

comment.author: 62508825@N00
comment._content: Another possibility: Henry Marshall Scott was born June 25, 1874 and married Elizabeth Morgan. Issue: Walter Scott, Frances Scott, Marion Scott, Jean Scott, Ethel Scott, Howard Scott He was 11th of 12 children born to William Godfrey Scott (1831-1908) and Martha Elizabeth Jamieson (1833-1934) a Canadian/American couple - this may be why a birth date is not found for Henry in the UK BMD nor an entry in the UK 1881 Census. Only one sibling's birthplace is known - Nova Scotia.in 1864. familytreemaker.genealogy.com/users/s/c/o/Donald-J-Scott-...

comment.author: 62508825@N00
comment._content: London Gazette December 16, 1892 VOLUNTEER CORPS. ARTILLERY 1st Norfolk (Eastern Division, Royal Artillery) ... to be Second Lieutenant:- Henry Marshall Scott. Dated 17th December, 1892. www.london-gazette.co.uk/issues/26354/pages/7400/page.pdf

comment.author: 64288588@N05
comment._content:
Rev Henry Marshall Scott died 1 March 1939 at Robin Hood, St John Vicarage, Kingston Vale, Surrey. Probate granted to Mary Adelaide Scott. Estate valued at £14,913.

1911 census shows him aged 40. He had been married to Mary Adelaide for 9 years and they had no children. He was born in Ravensdale, Co Louth, Ireland.

Irish Births and Baptisms index show that he was born 12 Mar 1871, son of James R Scott and Helen Marshall.
